US-based woman watches mother being thrashed in Ghaziabad home, sends brother to jail
description: A 44-year-old man was arrested in Ghaziabad for allegedly assaulting his elderly mother. The incident was captured on a CCTV camera installed by his sister living abroad, who alerted neighbours and police after witnessing the brutal attack. Legal action has been initiated against the accused.

title: Maharashtra dy CM Sunetra Pawar still facing scrutiny in Rs 25k cr bank scam
description: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Sunetra Pawar faces ongoing legal scrutiny in the Rs 25,000 crore MSCB scam, with the ED objecting to a clean chit.  She and Ajit Pawar were also investigated under Benami Properties law, with properties worth Rs 1,000 crore attached, though they later received relief. The scam involved rule violations in loan disbursements to cooperative sugar factories.

title: Indian Coast Guard gears up for 50th Raising Day ceremony
description: Aligned with the vision of ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ and ‘Make in India’, the ICG is steadily moving towards self-reliance through the induction of indigenously-built ships, aircraft, helicopters, and advanced surveillance systems, while simultaneously prioritising infrastructure development and personnel welfare, the ICG said in a statement

title: Right-wing group forces Dehradun Muslim trader to change shop name
description: Bajrang Dal members protested a Muslim trader's shop name in Kotdwar, demanding a change due to the term 'Baba'. The demonstration followed a viral video where a local fitness influencer, Deepak Kumar, defended the shopkeeper. Police have increased security, and the Bajrang Dal plans to file a complaint against Kumar.

title: Shailendra Singh says he paid Rs 4 cr to Amitabh Bachchan for Johnny Walker
description: Producer Shailendra Singh, known for backing National Award-winning films like Page 3 and Traffic Signal, has opened up about a long-standing dispute involving Amitabh Bachchan and filmmaker Shoojit Sircar over the unreleased film Shoebite. Singh claimed he had originally developed the story under the title Johnny Walker, which was later renamed Shoebite, and accused Shoojit of reselling the project to UTV’s Ronnie Screwvala despite him having already paid Bachchan an advance of Rs 4 crore.

This surge, fueled by domestic strength and manufacturing, signals a changing global economic landscape beyond traditional Western markets.

Turning Point USA announces platforms for rival Super Bowl halftime show
description: After months of silence, Turning Point USA has finally confirmed how fans can watch its alternative Super Bowl LX halftime show. The broadcast will stream on YouTube, X, Rumble, and several conservative TV networks. While distribution details are now clear, Turning Point USA has not revealed performers or production plans, which still leaves viewers with the question of what they will see when they tune in.

title: New details in Ryan Wedding case as FBI links wife, associates to drug killings
description: Former Olympic snowboarder Ryan Wedding has pleaded not guilty to federal charges tied to drug trafficking and murder. US authorities say he led a billion-dollar drug ring uncovered through Operation Giant Slalom. Several alleged associates, including his wife, girlfriend, lawyer, and international partners, have been sanctioned, arrested, or face extradition, according to the FBI and US Department of Justice.

title: Nvidia H-1B data reveals US pay as Jensen Huang reviews all compensation
description: Nvidia's soaring stock has created millionaires among its employees, with H-1B visa filings revealing substantial base salaries for critical roles. While CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes personal involvement in compensation, earlier hires have significantly benefited from equity appreciation. The data offers a glimpse into the pay for engineers, architects, researchers, and product managers, excluding bonuses and equity.

title: From WHO to GLP‑1: The week’s biggest health debates & India’s malaria challenge
description:
In this episode of Health Wrap, we track major shifts in global health governance following the United States’ formal withdrawal from the World Health Organization, a move that could reshape international public health coordination.

We also examine fresh developments in obesity treatment, as Indian drugmakers receive regulatory clearance to manufacture and sell generic versions of semaglutide, raising questions around access, affordability, and competition in the obesity-treatment market.

The episode also looks at rising scrutiny of social media platforms over their impact on children and adolescents, with courts and lawmakers in the United States and Europe assessing whether stronger, enforceable protections are needed.

We end with India’s progress toward eliminating malaria by 2030 -- reviewing gains made so far, state-level advances, and the challenges that remain in meeting this long-standing public health goal.

Presentation: Ramya Kannan and Zubeda Hamid 
Production: Athira Elssa Johnson 
Video and editing: Thamodharan B

title: Pain that shows up at night: Doctor explains the strange pattern of pain that waits for the lights to go off
description: Nighttime pain is a common experience, often dismissed as a nuisance. However, this persistent discomfort can signal underlying health conditions. Experts explain that rest at night can worsen pain from muscle and joint degeneration, nerve issues, or gastrointestinal problems. Persistent nighttime pain, especially with other symptoms, requires medical attention. Ignoring this pain means the body's signals go unheard.

title: Gabrielle Union breaks silence on fertility issues with Dwyane Wade
description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014 after dating for a couple of years. While both Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union had been through divorce before, the popular actress did not have a biological child of her own unlike the NBA legend. As the two tried to expand their family, Gabrielle Union details the trauma she faced as she failed to conceive.

title: Google cofounder makes biggest-ever public donation to tackle California housing crisis
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin has made his largest public donation, contributing $20 million to a new coalition tackling California's housing crisis. This significant move, backed by other tech leaders, comes as the state's wealthy face a potential wealth tax. Brin's philanthropy has been substantial, with billions donated to various causes, including climate solutions and medical research.
